FuncDef:
The icmp echo-reply fast disable command disables the fast ICMP reply function on the device.
The undo icmp echo-reply fast disable command enables the fast ICMP reply function on the device. The icmp echo-reply fast disable command disables the fast ICMP reply function on the device. The undo icmp echo-reply fast disable command enables the fast ICMP reply function on the device. By default, the fast ICMP reply function is enabled on the device.
ExtraInfo: By default, the fast ICMP reply function is enabled on the device. The device will quickly reply to the received ICMP Echo Request packets whose destination address is the device IP address, improving the forwarding performance. In some maintenance or debugging scenarios, you can run the icmp echo-reply fast disable command to disable the fast ICMP reply function.
